The information in Item 2.02 of this Current Report on Form 8-K shall not be incorporated by reference into any filing or other document pursuant to the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, except as may be expressly set forth by specific reference in such filing or document.</span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span><br/></span></div><div versus fourth-quarter 2022 Swedish Match shipments of 65.3 million cans</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Combustible tobacco net revenue growth of 5.3% on both a reported and organic basis, driven by pricing of 9.9%</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Full-Year</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Third consecutive year of volume growth driven by HTUs</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Adjusted in-market sales volume for HTUs, which excludes the net unfavorable impact of estimated distributor and wholesaler inventory movements, up by an estimated 14.8%</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Total </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> users at year-end estimated at approximately 28.6 million (up by 3.7 million versus December 2022), of which approximately 20.8 million had switched to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and stopped smoking </font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Market share for HTUs in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> markets up by 1.2 points to 9.1%</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> nicotine pouch shipment volume in the U.S. of 384.8 million cans, representing growth of 62.0% versus 2022 Swedish Match shipments of 237.5 million cans</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Increased regular quarterly dividend in September by 2.4% to $1.30 per share, or an annualized rate of $5.20 per share</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Combustible tobacco net revenue growth of 3.5%&#59; growth of 5.5% on an organic basis, driven by pricing of 8.9%</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Organic growth in adjusted operating income driven by the performance of smoke-free products</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_13"></div><div style="margin-top:15pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#34;Our business delivered a strong finish to 2023 and we achieved a number of remarkable milestones on our path to becoming a smoke-free company,&#34; said Jacek Olczak, Chief Executive Officer.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#34;We are pleased that smoke-free products reached nearly 40% of our total net revenues and over 40% of our gross profit in the fourth quarter. This was led by the continued growth of IQOS, which has now surpassed Marlboro in terms of net revenues, confirming its position as the leading premium nicotine brand less than 10 years from launch. The fourth quarter also marked the first anniversary of our combination with Swedish Match, which delivered very strong results in 2023 driven by the stellar U.S. performance of ZYN.&#34;</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#34;We are entering 2024 with strong momentum, and we expect it will be another year of excellent performance underpinned by an acceleration in organic smoke-free net revenue and profit growth.&#34;</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_16"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:15pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">2023 FULL-YEAR SUMMARY</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted net revenues increased by 7.8% on an organic basis, driven by total cigarette and HTU shipment volume growth of 1.0% (reflecting growth of 14.7% for HTUs and a decline of 1.4% for cigarettes), favorable category mix of smoke-free products and positive pricing.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 2 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 3.7% on an organic basis with a substantial acceleration in the second half of the year, as supply chain disruptions and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ILUMA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">-related factors continued to dissipate, coupled with an accelerating contribution from smoke-free products.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted diluted EPS of $6.01 increased by 11.0%, excluding currency, driven primarily by the organic growth in adjusted operating income, as well as the results of the Swedish Match business and its strong performance led by </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ZYN</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> in the U.S. The $0.20 unfavorable currency variance in the fourth quarter includes a $0.09 balance-sheet-related currency impact in Argentina. While the company&#8217;s affiliate in Argentina remains subject to highly inflationary accounting treatment, with the U.S. dollar treated as the functional currency, the impact reflects the depreciation of Argentine peso-denominated monetary net assets, which impacts earnings on a periodic basis when translated to U.S. dollars and are also subject to capital controls.</font></div><div style="margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Reported diluted EPS is forecast to be in a range of $5.90 to $6.02, at prevailing exchange rates, versus reported diluted EPS of $5.02 in 2023. Excluding a total 2024 adjustment of $0.42 per share and an adverse currency impact of $0.11, at prevailing exchange rates, this forecast represents a projected increase of 7.0% to 9.0% versus adjusted diluted EPS of $6.01 in 2023, as outlined in the above table.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">2024 Full-Year Forecast Assumptions</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">This forecast assumes&#58;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">An estimated total international industry volume decline for cigarettes and HTUs, excluding China and the U.S., of -2% to flat&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Total cigarette, HTU and oral smoke-free product shipment volume growth for PMI of flat to +1% driven by smoke-free products&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">14% to 16% adjusted in-market sales volume growth for HTUs, including an approximate 2 billion units adverse impact from consumer adjustment to the EU characterizing flavor ban, and essentially no growth in Russia, resulting in HTU shipment volumes of more than 140 billion units&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Nicotine pouch shipment volume in the U.S. of approximately 520 million cans&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Net revenue growth of 6.5% to 8% on an organic basis&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Organic operating income growth of 8% to 9.5%&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">An acceleration in organic smoke-free net revenue and gross profit growth compared to 2023&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font Healthcare segment&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">No earnings impact from any potential favorable court ruling related to the legality of a supplemental tax surcharge on HTUs in Germany, which went into effect in 2022 (see PMI's first-quarter 2023 press release </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 4 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">from April 20, 2023, for additional detail). The company currently expects to have greater visibility on the outcome in the first quarter of 2024&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Calibri',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:12.53pt">Full-year amortization of acquired intangibles of $0.42 per share, which includes an estimate of amortization of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> commercialization rights in the U.S. following the closing of the agreement to end our commercial relationship with Altria Group, Inc. covering </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> in the U.S. effective May 1, 2024. We currently estimate that the incremental increase in amortization expense in 2024, as a result of this transaction, will be approximately $370 million on a pre-tax basis for the remaining 8 months of the year. For full year 2025 through 2028, we currently estimate an annual impact of approximately $555 million on a pre-tax basis&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Net financing costs of approximately $1.3 to $1.4 billion&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">An effective tax rate, excluding discrete tax events, of approximately 21% to 22%&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Operating cash flow of $10 to $11 billion at prevailing exchange rates, subject to year-end working capital requirements&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font exchange rates as we continue to target a ratio of around 2x by the end of 2026&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font $1.42, including an estimated adverse currency impact of 10 cents at prevailing exchange rates.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font represent continuing risks to these projections.</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_2748779070048"></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">New Segment Structure</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Following the combination and the progress in 2023 toward integration of the Swedish Match business into the existing PMI regional segment structure, PMI will update its segment reporting by including Swedish Match results in the four existing geographical regions. As of the first quarter of 2024, PMI will report on this basis. The company plans to disclose select historical financial information for the 2021 to 2023 period reflecting the above mentioned change in the coming weeks.</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_2748779070115"></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Global Patent Settlement</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">On February 2, 2024 PMI announced that it has reached a global settlement with British American Tobacco p.l.c. that resolves all ongoing patent infringement litigation between the parties related to heated tobacco and vapor products. Please see the Form 8-K dated February 2, 2024 for additional detail.</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_28"></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Conference Call</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">A conference call hosted by Jacek Olczak, Chief Executive Officer, and Emmanuel Babeau, Chief Financial Officer, will be webcast at 9&#58;00 a.m., Eastern Time, on February 8, 2024. 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td colspan="2" style="background-color:#cceeff;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">(1) Excluding snuff, snuff leaf and U.S. chew</font></td></tr><tr><td colspan="27" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Note&#58; Sum may not foot due to roundings.</font></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-top:1pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume decreased by 0.5%, reflecting an 6.1% increase in HTU shipments across all regions except EA, AU &#38; PMI DF Region, partly offset by a 1.9% decline in cigarette shipments with declines in the EA, AU &#38; PMI DF Region, the Americas Region, as well as the SSEA, CIS &#38; MEA Region, and broadly stable cigarette shipments in the Europe Region. Cigarette shipment volume for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Marlboro</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> decreased by 0.8% to 60.2 billion units, due primarily to the Philippines.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI&#8217;s total oral product shipment volume increased by over 100%, driven by the Swedish Match acquisition. On a pro forma basis (including Swedish Match in all periods), it increased by 23.4%, primarily reflecting growth in nicotine pouches (particularly in the U.S.), partly offset by a decline for snus (mainly in Scandinavia). Swedish Match's total oral product shipment volume increased by 21.9% versus its corresponding shipments in 2022.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted in-market sales for HTUs increased by 13.9%, including growth in Europe of 13.1%, Japan of 13.4%. Excluding Russia and Ukraine, adjusted in-market sales for HTUs increased by 15.0%. The net unfavorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements for HTUs was driven primarily by Japan.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Full-Year</font></div><div style="margin-top:1pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume increased by 1.0%, reflecting an 14.7% increase in HTU shipments across all regions, partly offset by a 1.4% decline in cigarette shipments due to declines in the Europe, EA, AU &#38; PMI DF, and Americas Regions, partly offset by the SSEA, CIS &#38; MEA Region. Cigarette shipment volume for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Marlboro</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> decreased by 1.9% to 240.0 billion units, due primarily to the Philippines.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 6 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI&#8217;s total oral product shipment volume increased by over 100%, driven by the Swedish Match acquisition. On a pro forma basis (including Swedish Match in all periods), it increased by 16.8%, primarily reflecting the same factors as in the quarter. Swedish Match's total oral product shipment volume increased by 17.1% versus its corresponding shipments in 2022.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted in-market sales for HTUs increased by 14.8% (in line with full-year HTUs shipment volume growth of 14.7%), including growth in Europe of 17.6% and Japan of 14.5%. Excluding Russia and Ukraine, adjusted in market sales for HTUs increased by 17.1%.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">International Share of Market - Cigarettes and HTUs</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 8.0% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; the favorable pricing variance&#59; partially offset by higher marketing, administration and research costs (primarily due to inflationary impacts, notably related to wages) as well as higher manufacturing costs. style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted net revenues increased by 7.8% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, primarily driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing, and favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by higher HTU </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 9 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">volume, partially offset by lower cigarette volume and lower fees for certain distribution rights billed to customers in certain markets.</font></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Cost of sales, excluding currency and acquisitions, increased by 8.4%, driven by higher manufacturing costs (primarily due to inflationary impacts, notably related to direct materials, tobacco leaf and energy, partly offset by productivity) and unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly reflecting unfavorable category mix (notably due to lower cigarette volume and higher HTU volume), as well as the technical impact of third-party manufacturing in Indonesia. This increase was partially offset by the Swedish Match AB acquisition accounting related item in 2022, the impairment charge of other intangible assets in 2022 and lower charges related to the War in Ukraine.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 3.7% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; the favorable pricing variance&#59; partly offset by higher marketing, administration and research costs (primarily due to inflationary impacts, notably related to wages, and lower commercial investments in the prior year period)&#59; higher manufacturing costs (as explained for cost of sales)&#59; and the impact of lower fees for certain distribution rights, as noted for net revenues.</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_37"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:20pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">EUROPE REGION</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_40"></div><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Note&#58; Sum may not foot due to roundings.</font></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region decreased by 0.9% to 130.8 billion units, reflecting a 2.6% decline for cigarettes, partly offset by a 13.2% increase for HTUs. The decrease in the estimated total market was predominantly due to the UK (down by 16.7%), the Czech Republic (down by 14.7%) and France (down by 7.3%), partly offset by Italy (up by 2.5%).</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region increased by 2.6% to 53.6 billion units, mainly due to Poland (up by 10.6%), Italy (up by 4.0%) and Ukraine (up by 14.9%), partly offset by France (down by 13.7%&#59; or by 8.3% excluding the net unfavorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements) and Germany (down by 6.2%).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's estimated HTU adjusted in-market sales volume in the Region increased by 13.1% in the quarter, reflecting the strong continued growth momentum for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> (including in Germany, where adjusted in-market sales volume for HTUs increased by 19.5%).</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 10 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's HTU share of the total cigarette and HTU market in the Region increased by 1.1 points, or by 1.2 points on an adjusted basis.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Full-Year</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region decreased by 1.3% to 542.3 billion units, reflecting a 3.0% decline for cigarettes, partly offset by a 15.6% increase for HTUs. The decrease in the estimated total market was predominantly due to the UK (down by 15.4%), France (down by 8.2%), Germany (down by 1.8%) and Spain (down by 2.4%), partly offset by Poland (up by 1.8%). </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region decreased by 0.6% to 214.9 billion units, mainly due to Germany (down by 6.0%), Italy (down by 2.8%&#59; or up by 0.4% excluding the net unfavorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements) and France (down by 7.3%), partly offset by Poland (up by 9.4%).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's estimated HTU adjusted in-market sales volume in the Region increased by 17.6%, including growth in Germany and Italy of 29.7% and 16.6%, respectively.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's HTU share of the total cigarette and HTU market in the Region increased by 1.3 points, or by 1.5 points on an adjusted basis.</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_43"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Financial Summary</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div favorable pricing variance&#59; favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly reflecting higher HTU volume, partly offset by lower cigarette volume, as well as unfavorable cigarette mix&#59; partly offset by higher marketing, administration and research costs (primarily due to inflationary impacts) as well as higher manufacturing costs.</font></div><div 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">(1) See Schedule 9 in Exhibit 99.2 to the Form 8-K style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 3.7% on an organic basis, reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, mainly driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing&#59; partially offset by unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to lower cigarette volume, as well as unfavorable cigarette mix, partly offset by higher HTU volume.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income decreased by 0.3% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; higher marketing, administration and research costs (mainly due to inflationary impacts and lower commercial investments in the prior year period)&#59; higher manufacturing costs (primarily due to inflationary impacts)&#59; and unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to the same factors as for net revenues&#59; partly offset by the favorable pricing variance.</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_46"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:20pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td colspan="2" style="background-color:#cceeff;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">1.3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">%</font></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region decreased by approximately 1% to 389.2 billion units, due to a decline for cigarettes. The decrease in the estimated total market was mainly due to Egypt (down by 21.8%) and Pakistan (down by 25.1%), partly offset by Turkey (up by 13.3%).</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region increased by 0.5% to 90.5 billion units, mainly driven by Turkey (up by 19.0%), partly offset by the Philippines (down by 25.5%). PMI's estimated HTU adjusted in-market sales volume increased by 13.0%, with 22.5% HTU shipment volume growth, primarily due to comparison effects, notably in Russia.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 12 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Full-Year</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region decreased by approximately 2% to 1,528.6 billion units, due to a decline for cigarettes. The decrease in the estimated total market was predominantly due to Egypt (down by 20.9%) and Pakistan (down by 35.1%), partly offset by Turkey (up by 16.9%).</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Our Regional market share increased by 0.8 points to 23.4%.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region increased by 1.3% to 358.2 billion units, mainly driven by Turkey (up by 23.0%), partly offset by the Philippines (down by 26.2%). PMI's estimated HTU adjusted in-market sales volume increased by 8.2% including limited growth in Russia.</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_52"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Financial Summary</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 13.0% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, mainly driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing&#59; and favorable volume&#47;mix, driven by higher HTU volume and favorable cigarette mix, partly offset by lower cigarette volume.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 8.4% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; the favorable pricing variance, partly offset by higher marketing, administration and research costs&#59; higher manufacturing costs (primarily due to inflationary impacts)&#59; and unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to an unfavorable cigarette volume impact.</font></div><div Middle East</font></td></tr><tr><td colspan="42" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><font detail.</font></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:13pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted net revenues increased by 12.4% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, mainly driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing, with HTU pricing also higher&#59; favorable volume&#47;mix, primarily driven by favorable cigarette mix, as well as higher volume for HTUs, partly offset by an unfavorable cigarette volume impact&#59; and partially offset by lower fees for certain distribution rights billed to customers in certain markets, shown in &#34;Cost&#47;Other.&#34;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income decreased by 1.1% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; higher marketing, administration and research costs&#59; higher manufacturing costs (primarily due to inflationary impacts)&#59; unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to an unfavorable cigarette volume impact and unfavorable cigarette mix, partly offset by higher HTU volume&#59; and the impact of lower fees for certain distribution rights, as noted for net </font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">revenues&#59; partially offset by the favorable pricing variance.</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_55"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:20pt;text-align:center"><font style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 14 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region, excluding China, decreased by around 1% to 80.7 billion units, with growth for HTUs more than offset by a decline for cigarettes. The decrease in the estimated total market was driven by Taiwan (down by 18.1%), partly offset by International Duty Free (up by 26.3%).</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region decreased by 7.5% to 23.2 billion units, driven by Japan (down by 13.3%).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's estimated HTU adjusted in-market sales volume in the Region increased by 15.4% in the quarter, including growth in Japan of 13.4%, primarily due to comparison effects.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Full-Year</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region, excluding China, increased by 1% to 319.8 billion units, reflecting growth for HTUs, partly offset by a decline for cigarettes. The increase in the estimated total market was mainly driven by International Duty Free (up by 35.7%), partly offset by Taiwan (down by 7.4%) and Australia (down by 19.4%).</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Our Regional market share increased by 1.3 points to 30.0%.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region increased by 6.7% to 101.2 billion units, mainly &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;driven by Japan (up by 9.7%) and International Duty Free (up by 14.5%).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's estimated HTU adjusted in-market sales volume in the Region increased by 15.8%, including growth in Japan of 14.5%.</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_61"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Financial Summary</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:498.00pt"><tr><td style="width:1.0pt"></td><td style="width:121.00pt"></td><td style="width:1.0pt"></td><td style="width:1.0pt"></td><td style="width:37.75pt"></td><td style="width:1.0pt"></td><td style="width:1.0pt"></td><td style="width:1.75pt"></td><td style="width:1.0pt"></td><td style="width:1.0pt"></td><td style="width:37.00pt"></td><td style="width:1.0pt"></td><td style="width:1.0pt"></td><td style="width:42.25pt"></td><td mainly driven by higher HTU volume, partly offset by lower cigarette volume and unfavorable smoke-free product mix (for HTUs and devices)&#59; and a favorable pricing variance, driven by higher combustible tobacco and device pricing, partly offset by lower HTU (net) pricing (primarily related to Japan).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 27.7% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting favorable volume&#47;mix, primarily driven by higher HTU volume, partly offset by lower cigarette volume and unfavorable HTU mix&#59; the favorable pricing variance&#59; and lower supply chain costs (primarily related to Japan).</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_64"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:20pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">(3.9)</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 1pt style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 16 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region, excluding the U.S., decreased by around 2% to 49.9 billion units, primarily reflecting a decline for cigarettes. The decrease in the estimated total market was mainly due to Mexico (down by 8.7%), Argentina (down by 8.1%) and Canada (down by 11.2%), partly offset by Brazil (up by 11.7%).</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region decreased by 5.1% to 17.7 billion units, mainly due to Mexico (down by 11.6%) and Argentina (down by 10.7%), partly offset by Brazil (up by 13.3%).</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Full-Year</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region, excluding the U.S., decreased by around 1% to 189.2 billion units, driven by a decline for cigarettes. The decrease in the estimated total market was mainly due to Mexico (down by 6.8%), Canada (down by 12.6%) and Argentina (down by 5.0%), partly offset by Brazil (up by 10.1%).</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Our Regional market share, excluding the U.S., decreased by 1.1 points to 33.7%.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region decreased by 3.9% to 63.9 billion units, mainly due to Mexico (down by 9.8%) and  Argentina (down by 7.9%), partly offset by Brazil (up by 12.8%).</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_70"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Financial primarily reflecting&#58; unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to lower cigarette volume and unfavorable cigarette mix&#59; partly offset by a favorable pricing variance, driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income decreased by 52.6% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to the same factors as for net revenues&#59; higher marketing and administration costs (including incremental investments in the U.S. in preparation for smoke-free product commercialization)&#59; and higher manufacturing costs&#59; partly offset by the favorable pricing variance.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues decreased by 2.9% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to lower cigarette volume and unfavorable cigarette mix&#59; partly offset by a favorable pricing variance, driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income decreased by 38.2% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; higher marketing, administration and research costs (notably reflecting the same factors as in the quarter)&#59; unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to the same factors as for net revenues&#59; partly offset by the favorable pricing variance. </font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_73"></div><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 18 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Volume comparisons versus Swedish Match's 2022 results reflect data </font></div><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">sourced from its disclosures, available at www.swedishmatch.com&#47;investors.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Fourth-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Swedish Match's total shipment volume for oral products increased by 21.9% versus its corresponding shipments of 175.2 million cans in the fourth quarter of 2022.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Nicotine pouch shipment volume increased by 68.6% compared to Swedish Match's fourth-quarter 2022 shipment volume of 73.8 million cans, mainly driven by 78.2% growth for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ZYN</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> in the U.S. -- an outstanding performance that reflected continued broad strength across the country. In Scandinavia, shipment volume for nicotine pouches grew by 3.0%.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Shipment volume for snus declined by 17.6% compared to Swedish Match's fourth-quarter 2022 shipment volume of 69.3 million cans. The decrease was primarily due to Scandinavia, mainly reflecting the comparison versus a strong total market in the prior year period.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Full-Year</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Swedish Match's total shipment volume for oral products increased by 17.1% versus its corresponding shipments of 667.1 million cans in 2022.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Nicotine pouch shipment volume increased by 55.3% compared to Swedish Match's 2022 shipment volume of 269.2 million cans, reflecting 62.0% growth for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ZYN</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> in the U.S. In Scandinavia, shipment volume for nicotine pouches grew by 6.1%.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Shipment volume for snus declined by 13.8% compared to Swedish Match's 2022 shipment volume of 261.0 million cans.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Swedish Match's performance in the period primarily reflected the same factors as in the quarter, coupled with the impact of excise tax and price increases on snus in Scandinavia in the first quarter (including related inventory movements).</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:1pt;text-align:center"><table style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI recorded net revenues of $682 million in the Swedish Match segment for the fourth-quarter. Compared to Swedish Match's full fourth-quarter 2022 results, net revenues increased by 25.7%, excluding currency. This was mainly driven by the strong growth of smoke-free products, led by nicotine pouch volume growth in the U.S.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font position in  the company, through December 31, 2022</font></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI recorded net revenues of $2.5 billion in the Swedish Match segment for the full-year period, with smoke-free products accounting for over 80% of the segment's total net revenues. Compared to Swedish Match's full 2022 results for the same period, net revenues increased by 20.1%, excluding currency. This was mainly driven by the strong growth of smoke-free products, led by nicotine pouch volume growth in the U.S., as well as higher pricing for cigars.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI recorded adjusted operating income of $1,214 million in the segment, reflecting an adjusted operating income margin of 48.6%.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 20 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">(1) See Schedule 9 in Exhibit 99.2 to the Form 8-K dated February 8, 2024, for additional detail.</font></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 11.8% on an organic basis, notably reflecting the higher net revenues for smoking cessation products and select inhalation products.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The adjusted operating loss of $132 million was primarily due to commercial investments and higher administration costs.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 21 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:15pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_79"></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Philip Morris International&#58; Delivering a Smoke-Free Future</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Philip Morris International (PMI) is a leading international tobacco company, actively delivering a smoke-free future and evolving its portfolio for the long term to include products outside of the tobacco and nicotine sector. The company&#8217;s current product portfolio primarily consists of cigarettes and smoke-free products. Since 2008, PMI has invested $12.5 billion to develop, scientifically substantiate and commercialize innovative smoke-free products for adults who would otherwise continue to smoke, with the goal of completely ending the sale of cigarettes. This includes the building of world-class scientific assessment capabilities, notably in the areas of pre-clinical systems toxicology, clinical and behavioral research, as well as post-market studies. In 2022, PMI acquired Swedish Match &#8211; a leader in oral nicotine delivery &#8211; creating a global smoke-free champion led by the companies&#8217; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ZYN</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> brands. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has authorized versions of PMI&#8217;s </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> Platform 1 devices and consumables and Swedish Match&#8217;s </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">General</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> snus as Modified Risk Tobacco Products. As of December&#160;31, 2023, PMI's smoke-free products were available for sale in 84 markets, and PMI estimates that approximately 20.8 million adults around the world had already switched to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and stopped smoking. Smoke-free products accounted for approximately 37% of PMI&#8217;s total full-year 2023 net revenues. With a strong foundation and significant expertise in life sciences, PMI announced in February 2021 its ambition to expand into wellness and healthcare areas and, through its Vectura Fertin Pharma business, aims to enhance life through the delivery of seamless health experiences. For more information, please visit www.pmi.com and www.pmiscience.com.</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_82"></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Forward-Looking and Cautionary Statements</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">This press release contains projections of future results and goals and other forward-looking statements, including statements regarding expected financial or operational performance&#59; capital allocation plans&#59; investment strategies&#59; regulatory outcomes&#59; market expectations&#59; and business plans and strategies. Achievement of future results is subject to risks, uncertainties and inaccurate assumptions. In the event that risks or uncertainties materialize, or underlying assumptions prove inaccurate, actual results could vary materially from those contained in such forward-looking statements. Pursuant to the &#8220;safe harbor&#8221; provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995, PMI is identifying important factors that, individually or in the aggregate, could cause actual results and outcomes to differ materially from those contained in any forward-looking statements made by PMI.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's business risks include&#58; excise tax increases and discriminatory tax structures&#59; increasing marketing and regulatory restrictions that could reduce our competitiveness, eliminate our ability to communicate with adult consumers, or ban certain of our products in certain markets or countries&#59; health concerns relating to the use of tobacco and other nicotine-containing products and exposure to environmental tobacco smoke&#59; litigation related to tobacco use and intellectual property&#59; intense competition&#59; the effects of global and individual country economic, regulatory and political developments, natural disasters and conflicts&#59; the impact and consequences of Russia's invasion of Ukraine&#59; changes in adult smoker behavior&#59; the impact of COVID-19 on PMI's business&#59; lost revenues as a result of counterfeiting, contraband and cross-border purchases&#59; governmental investigations&#59; unfavorable currency exchange rates and currency devaluations, and limitations on the ability to repatriate funds&#59; adverse changes in applicable corporate tax laws&#59; adverse changes in the cost, availability, and quality of tobacco and other agricultural products and raw materials, as well as components and materials for our electronic devices&#59; and the integrity of its information systems and effectiveness of its data privacy policies. </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 22 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's future profitability may also be adversely affected should it be unsuccessful in its attempts to produce and commercialize reduced-risk products or if regulation or taxation do not differentiate between such products and cigarettes&#59; if it is unable to successfully introduce new products, promote brand equity, enter new markets or improve its margins through increased prices and productivity gains&#59; if it is unable to expand its brand portfolio internally or through acquisitions and the development of strategic business relationships&#59; if it is unable to attract and retain the best global talent, including women or diverse candidates&#59; or if it is unable to successfully integrate and realize the expected benefits from recent transactions and acquisitions. Future results are also subject to the lower predictability of our reduced-risk product category's performance.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI is further subject to other risks detailed from time to time in its publicly filed documents, including PMI's Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fourth quarter and year ended December 31, 2022, Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the third quarter ended September 30, 2023, and the Form 10-K for the fourth quarter and year ended December 31, 2023, which will be filed later today. PMI cautions that the foregoing list of important factors is not a complete discussion of all potential risks and uncertainties. PMI does not undertake to update any forward-looking statement that it may make from time to time, except in the normal course of its public disclosure obligations.</font></div><div id="i61af9893bf5147fd864c6820c908d419_85"></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Non-GAAP Measures, Glossary and Explanatory Notes</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Reconciliations of non-GAAP measures in this release to the most directly comparable U.S. GAAP measures can be found in Exhibit 99.2 to the Form 8-K dated February 8, 2024, and at www.pmi.com&#47;2023Q4earnings. A glossary of key terms, definitions and explanatory notes is available in the aforementioned Exhibit 99.2 and on the same webpage, where additional financial schedules, as well as adjustments and other calculations have also been made available.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Management reviews net revenues, gross profit, operating income, operating income margin, operating cash flow and earnings per share, or &#34;EPS,&#34; on an adjusted basis, which may exclude the impact of currency and other items such as acquisitions, asset impairment and exit costs, tax items and other special items. Additionally, starting in 2022 and on a comparative basis, for these measures other than net revenues and operating cash flow, PMI includes adjustments to add back amortization expense on acquisition related intangible assets that are recorded as part of purchase accounting and contribute to PMI&#8217;s revenue generation, as well as impairment of intangible assets, if any. While amortization expense on acquisition related intangible assets is excluded in these adjusted measures, the net revenues generated from these acquired intangible assets are included in the company's adjusted measures, unless otherwise stated. Currency-neutral and organic growth rates reflect the way management views underlying performance for these measures. PMI believes that such measures provide useful insight into underlying business trends and results. Management reviews these measures because they exclude changes in currency exchange rates and other factors that may distort underlying business trends, thereby improving the comparability of PMI&#8217;s business performance between reporting periods. Furthermore, PMI uses several of these measures in its management compensation program to promote internal fairness and a disciplined assessment of performance against company targets. PMI discloses these measures to enable investors to view the business through the eyes of management.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Non-GAAP measures used in this release should neither be considered in isolation nor as a substitute for the financial measures prepared in accordance with U.S. GAAP.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 23 -</font></div></div></div><div
